Name: official/sonar
Description: SonarQube is an open source quality management platform, dedicated to continuously analyze and measure source code quality

Configuration.Name: sonar.updatecenter.url
Configuration.Description: Set custom SonarQube UpdateCenter URL

Configuration.Name: sonar.plugins.default
Configuration.Description: Comma separated list of plugin names to install on start

Configuration.Name: sonar.web.sso.refreshIntervalInMinutes
Configuration.Description: The interval used to know when to refresh name, email, and groups. During this interval, if for instance the name of the user is changed in the header, it will only be updated after X minutes.

Configuration.Name: sonar.web.sessionTimeoutInMinutes
Configuration.Description: Inactive session timeout (in minutes). The maximum time a user can remain idle (no activity) before the session ends. The minimum value is 6, the maximum value 129600 (90 days).

Configuration.Name: container_config/swap_limit
Configuration.Description: Limits the container's swap memory usage. Use zero or a positive integer value followed by one of these units [b,k,m,g] (byte, kibibyte, mebibyte, gibibyte). 0 will disable swapping.

Configuration.Name: container_config/java_sonar_main_max_ram_percentage
Configuration.Description: Limits the heap stack size of the Sonar main process to the configured percentage of the available physical memory when the container has more than approx. 250 MB of memory available. Is only considered when a memory_limit is set. Use a valid float value with decimals between 0 and 100 (f. ex. 55.0 for 55%). Default value for Sonar main: 25%

Configuration.Name: container_config/java_sonar_main_min_ram_percentage
Configuration.Description: Limits the heap stack size of the Sonar main process to the configured percentage of the available physical memory when the container has less than approx. 250 MB of memory available. Is only considered when a memory_limit is set. Use a valid float value with decimals between 0 and 100 (f. ex. 55.0 for 55%). Default value for Sonar main: 50%

Configuration.Name: container_config/java_sonar_web_max_min_ram_percentage
Configuration.Description: Limits the heap stack size of the Sonar web background process to the configured percentage of the available physical memory. Is only considered when a memory_limit is set. Use a valid float value with decimals between 0 and 100 (f. ex. 55.0 for 55%). Default value for Sonar web: 10%

Configuration.Name: container_config/java_sonar_search_max_min_ram_percentage
Configuration.Description: Limits the heap stack size of the Sonar search background process to the configured percentage of the available physical memory. Is only considered when a memory_limit is set. Use a valid float value with decimals between 0 and 100 (f. ex. 55.0 for 55%). Default value for Sonar search: 10%

Configuration.Name: container_config/java_sonar_cengine_max_min_ram_percentage
Configuration.Description: Limits the heap stack size of the Sonar compute engine background process to the configured percentage of the available physical memory. Is only considered when a memory_limit is set. Use a valid float value with decimals between 0 and 100 (f. ex. 55.0 for 55%). Default value for Sonar compute engine: 10%

Configuration.Name: amend_projects_with_ces_admin_permissions
Configuration.Description: If set to a current timestamp, the ces-admin group will be enabled to administer all projects. The timestamp has to be in the format `YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss` (e.g. `2025-03-20 09:30:00`). The Dogu saves the timestamp of the last execution internally and compares this timestamp with the timestamp from the configuration. If the timestamp entered in the configuration is “newer”, the projects are corrected when the dogu is restarted.

Configuration.Name: logging/root
Configuration.Description: Set the root log level to one of ERROR, WARN, INFO, DEBUG, TRACE.

Configuration.Name: container_config/memory_limit
Configuration.Description: Limits the container's memory usage. Use a positive integer value followed by one of these units [b,k,m,g] (byte, kibibyte, mebibyte, gibibyte).

Configuration.Name: container_config/memory_request
Configuration.Description: Requests the container's minimal memory requirement. Use a positive integer value followed by one of these units [b,k,m,g] (byte, kibibyte, mebibyte, gibibyte).

Configuration.Name: container_config/cpu_core_limit
Configuration.Description: Limits the container's CPU core usage. Use a positive floating value describing a fraction of 1 CPU core. When you define a value of '0.5', you are requesting half as much CPU time compared to if you asked for '1.0' CPU.

Configuration.Name: container_config/cpu_core_request
Configuration.Description: Requests the container's minimal CPU core requirement. Use a positive floating value describing a fraction of 1 CPU core. When you define a value of '0.5', you are requesting half as much CPU time compared to if you asked for '1.0' CPU.

Configuration.Name: container_config/storage_limit
Configuration.Description: Limits the container's ephemeral storage usage. Use a positive integer value followed by one of these units [b,k,m,g] (byte, kibibyte, mebibyte, gibibyte).

Configuration.Name: container_config/storage_request
Configuration.Description: Requests the container's minimal ephemeral storage requirement. Use a positive integer value followed by one of these units [b,k,m,g] (byte, kibibyte, mebibyte, gibibyte).

Configuration.Name: profiles/url
Configuration.Description: The url to download a zip file containing quality profiles to be imported.

Configuration.Name: profiles/user
Configuration.Description: The user to download the quality profiles to be imported.

Configuration.Name: profiles/password
Configuration.Description: The password to download quality profiles to be imported.

Configuration.Name: profiles/retry_limit
Configuration.Description: The number of attempts to try to download the quality profiles.

Configuration.Name: profiles/allow_insecure
Configuration.Description: A flag to skip HTTPS certificate checks. Useful for development with self signed certificates.

Configuration.Name: profiles/force_upload
Configuration.Description: A flag to indicate that the profile archive should always be uploaded. Use this only if profiles got deleted manually in the dogu. Don't forget to turn this option to false after using it.
